@graph.name: How to Change Shopify Themes Safely
@graph.description: Step-by-step guide to changing Shopify themes without losing content or customizations

step.name: Backup Current Theme
step.text: Create a backup of your current theme files before making any changes to ensure you can revert if needed.

step.name: Browse Theme Store
step.text: Access the Shopify theme store via your dashboard and explore free, paid, and third-party themes.

step.name: Preview Theme
step.text: Use the preview function to test how the new theme looks on desktop, tablet, and mobile devices.

step.name: Install and Customize
step.text: Add the chosen theme to your theme library and customize using Shopify's theme editor.

step.name: Test and Publish
step.text: Test all functionality, check mobile responsiveness, and publish when satisfied with the results.

mainEntity.name: Will I lose content when changing Shopify themes?

acceptedAnswer.text: No, when you publish a new theme, all your content like product details, images, and pages remains intact. However, customizations and app integrations should be double-checked.

mainEntity.name: How do I make my Shopify theme mobile-friendly?

acceptedAnswer.text: Most themes in the Shopify theme store are responsive. Use the theme editor's preview function to test mobile views and adjust settings like font size, image placement, and button size for optimal mobile experience.

mainEntity.name: Can I switch back to my old theme?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, you can easily switch back to an old theme by finding it in your theme library and clicking 'Actions' followed by 'Publish'. Your store will revert without losing content or settings.

mainEntity.name: How do I maintain SEO when changing themes?

acceptedAnswer.text: Keep an eye on meta tags, alt text, and URL structure when switching themes. Use Google Search Console to identify potential issues and ensure the new theme doesn't break existing URLs or remove important SEO elements.

hasDefinedTerm.description: Shopify's built-in tool for customizing themes using drag-and-drop functionality and visual editing.
